elements.title: Uzun-Hajji (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although Uzun-Hajji and Najmuddin of Gotzo (both pictured) were originally political allies, they later fought on opposing sides of the Russian Civil War?

elements.title: Battle of Kembogo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that rebel fighters pursued their fleeing enemies during the Battle of Kembogo because they wanted new boots?

elements.title: Abdul Ahad Azad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Abdul Ahad Azad is recognised for laying the foundations of literary criticism in Kashmiri literature?

elements.title: Episode 7921 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Episode 7921 of Neighbours features Australia's first televised same-sex wedding since the country voted in favour of legalising same-sex marriage?

elements.title: 2024 Summer Paralympics opening ceremony (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2024 Summer Paralympics opening ceremony featured dancing Phryges?

elements.title: Albert Bumgardner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Albert Bumgardner's design for an architectural press office was highly publicized in the architectural press?

elements.title: You Liked This (Okay, Computer!) (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the song "You Liked This (Okay, Computer!)" features the former text-to-speech voice of TikTok?

elements.title: Charlotte Motor Speedway (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that drivers "dodge[d] track blemishes" more than each other during the first race at the Charlotte Motor Speedway?

elements.title: Dim Montero (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that football coach Dim Montero was considered such a great recruiter that it was said he "could pick up a rock and find an outstanding football prospect"?
